intro: Marathrum stenocarpum, commonly known as the narrow-fruit marathrum, is a flowering plant native to the south-western regions of Western Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow fruits and its preference for well-drained, sandy soils. It typically grows in open habitats such as heathlands and is adapted to the dry, temperate climate of its native region. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
